Our argument clearly shows that the solution set for the inequality |x + 5| < 10 is -15 < x < 5. While your argument correctly identifies the range -15 < x < 5, it mistakenly includes the endpoints. Since the inequality is strict (|x + 5| < 10), we must exclude -15 and 5. Our method accurately reflects the nature of strict inequalities, ensuring we only count integers within the open interval, thus reinforcing the correctness of our solution.
